page.title: 14Allington Church
page.content: {Allington }Church is dedicated to {St. {John}the {Baptist.}It is built mainly of stone, flint and red brick tiles. It has a tower with two gargoyles. It is over{800 years old.}The earlist grave recorded is about {200 years {ago. } The first recorded rector was a man called {robert}in{1297.}The longest serving rector was a man called { {William Fowle.} He served for {50 {years.}The church seats 56 people.It has a wooden pulpit,wooden beams and wooden pews.The chalice,the cup for the wine, dates back to {1576.}It has been used approximately {20,800 }times by {416,000}people.There is one exit from the church but there used to be two.In 172 years,273 babys were baptised.The church was rebuilt in {1840.} {by Kevin Willis
